subject: History
title: Building the Great Pyramids
description: A quick, practical guide to Building the Great Pyramids.

hook.text: The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest structure on Earth for 3,800 years. Nothing came close.

buildup.text: Built around 2560 BC for Pharaoh Khufu, it used 2.3 million stone blocks averaging 2.5 tons each.

discovery.text: Workers weren't slaves. They were paid laborers who ate beef, bread, and beer daily.

twist.text: We still don't know exactly how they did it. Every theory has gaps that engineers debate today.

climax.text: The pyramids survived 4,500 years of earthquakes, wars, and treasure hunters. They endure.

punchline.text: The oldest wonder is the only one still standing.

quiz.question: Who actually built the Great Pyramids?
options: Paid laborers who received food and beer
Foreign mercenaries hired by the pharaoh
